Articles.Content: Any updates when a playable 64-bit version will come out that does not overload memory and does more than 5-10fps on a high-end PC, cq v1.1?
You should know better than to ask that... and if you don't, now you do..... here comes the mod lock hammer.

By now squad has a bot that adds one day to the release date every time someone asks one of these questions.

Relax. It will come soontm
I read somewhere they're aiming for a christmas release but I can't remember if that was official info or just speculation. But yeah it shouldn't be long now.

As far as I know, there is NO official release date/time period/vague guesstimation about when it'll come out.

Based on previous updates though, I'm guessing in the Christmas-March 2016 time area.

ROFL, peach

Sorry, but I spent money on a game that can barely works. If not for a work-around to lower the memory load, explained by a forum member, the game would not even run more than 20 max minutes, if it even starts up.

If I have 3-4 ships within 2km of each other the program just freaks out and framerate goes to 1fps while I can run the heaviest 3D games without breaking a sweat. There are structural problems with this game that need to be fixed. I don't know what 1.0.5 brought other than more airplane parts, but I see no improvement in the #1 problem with this game.

In before the lock!!!

But seriously- forbidden Q.

I have news on 1.1!

It exists and will someday be released.

Closed because rules, and yes 1.1 is coming.

2.3 Forbidden messages

Messages that inquire about release dates for future versions of KSP.

No news on 1.1 until devnotes (course, I can't say which devnotes) btw.

(Also yeah these threads tend to get locked, we only just had 1.0.5, jumping the gun a bit on 1.1)

If you'd like KSP to use less RAM maybe this will interest you
